taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section tholiformes;species noveboracus;

treatment.description: Resembling no. 113 but forming dense mounds 1 m. high; primocane-leaves more approximate, very firm, 3-7-foliolate, pubescent on nerves beneath; leaflets finely double-serrate, abruptly slender-tipped; terminal one round-ovate, nearly as broad as long, 7-9 cm. long; inflorescence short and compact, racemose-corymbiform, its foliaceous bracts acute; pedicels finely pilose, with very short bristles, up to 3 cm. long; calyx-lobes reflexed under the large (2 cm. long) fruit.
